title: PROGRAM 1: FOUNDATION BUILDER
subtitle: Weeks 1-4: Movement Habit Formation
subtitleDescription: These first four weeks focus on establishing the habit of regular movement without any pressure for intensity or perfection. The goal is simply to show up consistently and let your body remember how good it feels to move.
videoDescription: Learn the fundamental movement patterns that build true functional strength: squat, hinge, push, pull, carry, and rotate. These movements translate directly to real-life activities and athletic performance.
description: This program takes a gentle, progressive approach to establishing sustainable exercise habits. Starting with just 20 minutes of easy walking three times per week, it gradually builds both duration and frequency over 12 weeks. The focus is on creating consistency without overwhelming the body or mind. Strength training is intentionally delayed until week 9, allowing your cardiovascular system and movement patterns to adapt first.

sections.title: Overall Goals
items: Establish a consistent 3-5 day per week exercise routine
Build cardiovascular endurance from 15 to 30 minutes
Increase daily steps from under 5,000 to 5,500+
Create sustainable habits for long-term success

sections.title: Why It's Beneficial
items: Reduces overwhelm: Starting gradually is the key to long-term success
Builds confidence: Small, achievable goals create positive momentum
Prevents injury: Gradual progression allows tendons, ligaments, and muscles to adapt
Establishes habits: 12 weeks creates automatic behaviors that continue to build
Improves all health markers: Even light exercise significantly reduces disease risk

sections.title: Phase Goals
items: Learn to prioritize movement in your daily routine

items.text: Exercise 3x per week: 20 minutes per session

children: Easy cycling on a bike or stationary bike
Pace guide: You should be able to hold a conversation easily while exercising

items.text: Daily Step Target: 5,000 steps per day
On non-exercise days: Complete 10-15 minutes of gentle stretching

sections.title: Bonus Activities
items: Begin thinking about when you'll add strength training

closingNote: Functional Fitness Philosophy: These 6 movement patterns aren't gym exercises - they're fundamental human movements you use every day. Squatting is sitting down and standing up. Hinging is picking something off the floor safely. Pushing and pulling open doors and carry groceries. By strengthening these patterns, you're not just building muscle - you're building a body that moves better, feels better, and handles life better. This is fitness with purpose.
